Pre-Game Insights: Wales made light work of semi-final foes Finland in a 4-1 crushing.
Poland smashed Estonia 5-1 in their most recent tie.
Wales have a seven-match unbeaten run across all competitions.
Poland have an unbeaten run of five games under Probierz.
Wales haven't failed to score in front of their own fans in preliminary continental competition since September 2015.
Poland have not lost to Wales in their subsequent nine clashes in all tournaments, winning each of their last six from 2001 to 2022.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales would do well to attack Poland's depleted right-hand side in Cardiff, where home advantage should certainly play its part for a Dragons side who are seldom outclassed in home Euros qualifiers.
However, Poland have had their hosts' number in the 21st century, and the likes of Robert Lewandowski will need no second invitation to capitalise on Wales' defensive shortcomings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales needed just three minutes to draw first blood in their semi-final showdown with Finland through David Brooks.
Teemu Pukki beat the offside trap and managed to cut the deficit in half just before the break, but the former Norwich City striker's effort was quickly rendered meaningless.
Poland failed to truly assert their dominance in the first half of the other Path A playoff semi-final, where only a Przemyslaw Frankowski effort separated the two teams going into the break.

After ex-Tottenham Hotspur defender Maksim Paskotsi received his marching orders in the 27th minute, Poland made full use of their extra man in the second 45, as Piotr Zielinski, Jakub Piotrowski and Sebastian Szymanski all found the mark alongside a Karol Mets own goal.
Others: Wales' only beating from their last 16 home matches in Euros qualifying is a 4-2 loss to Armenia just nine months ago.

Poland's triumph over Estonia did not come without its sacrifices, as Frankowski was taken off at half time for Aston Villa's Matty Cash, who lasted just 10 minutes himself before succumbing to a suspected hamstring issue.
